name: Menorah
description: A traditional Jewish lampstand with seven branches used during the Hanukkah holiday.

name: Shofar
description: A ram's horn blown like a trumpet, used for Jewish religious purposes, especially during Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.

name: Kippah
description: A small, hemispherical cap worn by Jewish men during prayer and religious ceremonies.

name: Tallit
description: A fringed garment traditionally worn by Jewish men during prayer, especially at morning prayers.

name: Hamsa
description: A palm-shaped amulet popular throughout the Middle East and North Africa, commonly used in jewelry and wall hangings.

name: Kiddush Cup
description: A special cup used in Jewish religious ceremonies, especially during the Kiddush blessing on Shabbat and Jewish holidays.

name: Mezuzah
description: A small decorative case containing a scroll inscribed with specific Hebrew verses from the Torah, affixed to the doorframe of Jewish homes.

name: Challah Board
description: A special board used for cutting challah bread, a traditional Jewish braided bread.

name: Havdalah Set
description: A set of ceremonial items used during the Havdalah ritual marking the end of Shabbat.

name: Siddur
description: A Jewish prayer book containing a set order of daily prayers.
